channel.title: Perl
channel.description:
So today, I bought this book called Learning Perl (Llama book). I guess the writers of this didn't intend on a 16 year old kid reading this. I can't even figure out how to configure the compiler right. It's frustrating, this isn't my first langauge, nor is it my second. I know it takes a lifetime to learn perl, that's why I'm trying to start early. This may be some basic error, but I don't know.
Code:
[code=perl]#!/usr/bin/perl print "Hello, world!\n";[/code]
Error:
[code] $ perl my_program Bareword found where operator expected at - line 1, near "$ perl my_program" (Missing operator before my_program?)[/code]

item.title: Perl
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“Onix, post:4, topic:452405”][quote author=Xellium link=topic=555284.msg4065571#msg4065571 date=1343857288]

save the code as hello.pl and run perl hello.pl (ps being 16 is a bad excuse)

I’m was playing more on having the attention span of a 16 year old. Not the maturity or intelligence. Thank you for the help though.
[/quote]That’s just stereotypical. You don’t even need an excuse, people will still help you.[/quote]

Maybe on this forums, not on runeserver, they just ignore you. So I thought the same for all.

Read full topic

[/quote]

I’m was playing more on having the attention span of a 16 year old. Not the maturity or intelligence. Thank you for the help though. :D[/quote]That’s just stereotypical. You don’t even need an excuse, people will still help you.
